class solrq.solr.SolrCollection(host, collection, max_rows=50000)[source]¶

Bases: solrq.solr.SolrClient

SolrCollection class Never have to be instantiated directly. get_collection method of SolrClient object instantiates SolrCollection object

fetch(query, fields=None, num_rows=None)[source]¶

fetches all rows

Parameters:
  • query – str Query string. Example: ‘field1:val1 AND field2:val2’
  • fields – str comma separated list of fields. Example: [field1, field3]
  • num_rows – int number of rows to fetch
Returns:

a list of dicts or None if self.num_found exceeds self.max_rows
pre_fetch(query, fields)[source]¶

fetches the first 10 rows

Parameters:
  • query – str Query string. Example: ‘field1:val1 AND field2:val2’
  • fields – str comma separated list of fields. Example: [field1, field3]
Returns:

None
stats(query, fields, metrics=['min', 'max', 'sum', 'count', 'missing', 'sumOfSquaresmean', 'stddev', 'percentiles', 'distinctValues', 'countDistinct', 'cardinality'], percentiles='25,50,75')[source]¶

Gets basic statistics using Solr stats

Parameters:
  • query – str Example: ‘field1:val1 AND field2:val2’
  • fields – str. comma separated list of fields to compute stats on. Example: [field1, field3]
  • metrics – list of str list of metrics to be used Must be in [‘min’, ‘max’, ‘sum’, ‘count’, ‘missing’, ‘sumOfSquares’ ‘mean’, ‘stddev’, ‘percentiles’, ‘distinctValues’, ‘countDistinct’, ‘cardinality’]
  • percentiles – string of numbers separated by commas to calculate percentiles at Uses t-digest approximation algorithm
Returns:

dict with metrics as keys
